item.title: The Mystery of the Troublesome Window and Security
item.description: It can be frustrating when setting up security in GP 10.0 (or GP 2010). Take limiting access to payroll data, for instance. You disable the Payroll Clerk role, thinking that’s enough, but then you test it and find various Payroll windows still accessible. While the Payroll Clerk role manages transactions and cards, it doesn’t cover setup, utilities, routines, reports, Smartlists, or inquiries. Even after removing relevant tasks and roles, like those within the Accounting Manager role, some windows remain stubbornly visible.

item.title: Forecaster TRANSLATE -versus- TRANSLATEL
item.description: Understanding the distinction between the TRANSLATE and TRANSLATEL tasks in Forecaster is crucial for effective currency translation. While Forecaster generally operates on a straightforward currency conversion principle, utilizing an “originating” currency for input and mapping it to a “functional” currency for output, these tasks offer nuanced control. Even when auto-translate is active, situations may arise where manual intervention is needed. The key difference lies in the scope of translation. TRANSLATE comprehensively converts all departments or assignable segments from the “originating” to the “functional” currency.
